Breadth-First.Explanation: Initial broad clue collection with no specific hypothesis.
Listing multiple natural elements as part of open‐ended observation.
Describing water characteristics without committing to a location, broad exploration.
Enumerating vegetation clues in a divergent clue‐gathering mode.
Surveying geological features broadly, still without a hypothesis.
Assessing climate indicators in an open‐ended way.
Generating several location hypotheses loosely based on the gathered clues.
Further shallow hypothesis narrowing, still listing multiple regional candidates.
Focusing on a subset (Norway, Sweden, Scotland) but still exploring multiple options.
